intro: Cienfuegosia flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Cienfuegosia flaviflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, lowland areas.
